transcript_text: Thank you for calling. Jessal Paredes-Roberts. Please hold while I try to connect you. Jessal speaking. How can I help you today? Hi, Jessal. This is Robin Montoni with Main Sequence. Hi, how are you? I'm good. How are you doing? Good, thank you. Yeah, so I called earlier because one of our recruiters, I think, is having a little bit of an issue with, I think it's Outlook. It's either Outlook or PCR. So basically he sent an email to one of the clients via PCR. Like he pressed the email logo on their profile and then to send like a marketing email. And then after he sent that, he went on his Outlook account and it's showing on his sent folder that it's sent twice. Oh. Yeah, but on PCR activities, it's only showing that he sent it once. so I'm not sure like which side it's causing it or why it's causing it okay that is probably a setting does he have PCR mail configured um let me double check sorry let me just quickly go to his desk I could probably tell so what I think what's going on is that in PCR mail when you do the incoming mail server there's an option to make just put an extra a copy in the folder and And I think that's probably set to yes. So what's happening is it's sending once and we're putting an extra copy in the send folder, but it didn't actually send twice. But I can confirm once I look. What is the database name that person logs in as? The Newport Group. The Newport Group. Okay. Yep. And what is that person's username? Eric, E-R-I-C-S. E-R-I-C-S? Okay. Yeah, Eric S. Yep. let me see yeah it's probably just the one setting and unfortunately it's just put a copy there but it that's yeah that's what i uh gathered from google from what google was telling me but yeah i wasn't sure yeah it's probably just that one setting like with some mail servers we don't really have to not the majority of our clients are usually either gmail or uh yep outlook and they do it automatically yep that's exactly what it is okay so i'm going to split this setting so it's in that when you go into PCR mail the mail server screen when you go to configure it says save send email the sent items folder it was set to yes I'm going to set it to no yeah so going forward that should stop it okay perfect it only sent once though okay perfect yeah that's what I figured I figured it was just sent like a copy um but yeah that's that's good to know thank you so much at least uh in the future if anyone else has that issue then I'll I can just do that from my end. Thank you. Oh, no problem. You should be all set now. Awesome. Thank you so much. Have a great day. Thank you. Bye-bye. Bye.

sentiment_analysis.summary: The customer called about an issue where one of their recruiters sent an email through PCR, and it showed up as sent twice in their Outlook account, but only once in PCR. The agent was able to identify the issue as a setting in PCR that was causing a copy of the email to be saved in the sent folder, and they resolved the issue by changing that setting.

process_improvements: Implement a setting or feature in PCR to automatically sync sent emails between the application and the user's email client, eliminating the need for manual configuration.
Develop a knowledge base article or training module on common PCR email integration issues and how to resolve them, to empower support agents to quickly identify and fix similar problems.

strengths: The agent quickly identified the root cause of the issue and provided a clear solution.
The agent was patient and helpful in walking the customer through the troubleshooting steps.
improvements: The agent could have proactively asked for the customer's email account details earlier in the call to speed up the troubleshooting process.
suggested_phrases: To help me better understand the issue, could you please provide the email account details you're using with PCR?

follow_up_actions: Reach out to the customer to confirm the issue has been resolved and gather any additional feedback.
Review the call recording and transcript to identify any other potential process improvements or training needs.
Implement the recommended knowledge base update and ensure all support agents are aware of the solution.
knowledge_base_updates: Create a new knowledge base article on troubleshooting PCR email integration issues, including the steps to resolve the 'duplicate sent emails' problem.

escalation.reason: The issue was successfully resolved, and no further escalation is needed.

call_resolution.problem_statement: The customer's employee was experiencing an issue where emails sent through PCR were showing up twice in their Outlook sent folder, even though the activity log in PCR only showed the email being sent once.
call_resolution.resolution_details: The employee identified that the issue was caused by a setting in PCR mail that was configured to save a copy of the sent email in the Outlook sent items folder. The employee changed this setting to stop the duplicate emails from appearing.

follow_up.details: No further follow-up is needed, as the issue has been resolved.

missed_best_practices: Providing a timeline for any follow-up actions
Offering contact information in case the customer has any further questions
improvement_suggestions: Provide a timeline for any follow-up actions to set clear expectations
Offer contact information in case the customer has any further questions
